alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Douglas; South Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Carroll, southern Douglas and southwestern Fulton Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, an area of strong thunderstorms was centered near Carrollton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Douglasville, Carrollton, Fairburn, Palmetto, Whitesburg, Roopville, Chattahoochee Hills, Sweetwater Creek State Park, Byers Crossroads, Hannah, Tyus, Bill Arp, Chapel Hill, Seaton Lake, Fairplay, Clem, Lowell, Treasure Lake and Campbellton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and west central Georgia.
